The Ivy Stacks Reading Room is available by appointment to view large sets of materials not feasible to be transported to a library location On-Grounds.

Appointments must be made 5 business days* in advance of a visit, and are available Monday-Friday between the hours of 9 a.m. and 4 p.m.

*As the Ivy facility settles into normalcy after the relocation of Alderman materials, we may be able to lessen the 5 day wait. This policy will be revisited in summer 2020 and this page will be updated as appropriate.

Request Process 

  1. Materials must be requested via Virgo. Please choose the “Request from Ivy” button in the record of the item you would like to view. 
  2. Sign in to your ILLiad account. You will be asked to register if you have not made a request in the system before. 
  3. Review the information in your request and add any additional information. In the “Notes” field at the bottom of the request, please indicate that you would like to view your materials in the Ivy Reading Room and list the date you would like to visit in the Notes field. 
  4. A library staff person will contact you via email to confirm your appointment. 

Equipment Available 

  • Microform reader/scanner 
  • 11”x17” platen scanner 
  • LP turntable with headphones 

Parking 

Guest parking is available at the facility. You will be given a guest pass for your vehicle when you arrive. 

Questions 

You may contact Steve Bartlett, the Ivy Stacks Manager, at slb7c@virginia.edu or 434-924-0982 with any questions you have. 

For Special Collections materials at Ivy Stacks 

Special Collections materials require additional assistance. Please contact the Special Collections reference team through the Reference Request Form or by calling (434) 243-1672.
